qas.question: How long is the Sun Link?
What is Tucson's bus system called?
What transit systems does Sun Link connect to?

answers.text: the University of Arizona's CatTran shuttles, Amtrak, and Greyhound intercity bus service

qas.question: When did Tucson get a 'Best Transit System' award?
What kind of vehicles operate on the Sun Link?

context: Tucson's <a1_0>Sun Tran<a1_0/> bus system serves greater Tucson with standard, express, regional shuttle, and on-demand shuttle bus service. It was awarded Best Transit System in <a3_0>1988 and 2005<a3_0/>. A <a0_0>3.9-mile<a0_0/> <a4_0>streetcar<a4_0/> line, Sun Link, connects the University of Arizona campus with 4th Avenue, downtown, and the Mercado District west of Interstate 10 and the Santa Cruz River. Ten-minute headway passenger service began July 25, 2014. The streetcar utilizes Sun Tran's card payment and transfer system, connecting with <a2_0>the University of Arizona's CatTran shuttles, Amtrak, and Greyhound intercity bus service<a2_0/>.
